ul.li1: 1Does not wisdom call,
ul.li2: and understanding raise its voice?
ul.li1: 2Atop the heightsLiterally “At a head of the heights” beside the road,
ul.li2: at the crossroads she stands.
ul.li1: 3Beside gates, before towns,
ul.li2: at the entrance of doors, she cries out:
ul.li1: 4“To you, O people,Literally “men” I call,
ul.li2: and my cry is to the children of humankind.
ul.li1: 5Learn prudence, O simple ones;
ul.li2: fools, learn intelligence.Literally “heart”
ul.li1: 6Listen! For noble things I will speak,
ul.li2: and upright things from the opening of my lips.
ul.li1: 7My mouth will utter truth,
ul.li2: and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
ul.li1: 8All sayings of my mouth are in righteousness;
ul.li2: none of them are twisted and crooked.
ul.li1: 9All of them are straight to him who understands,
ul.li2: and upright to those who find knowledge.
ul.li1: 10Take my teaching and not silver;
ul.li2: may you choose knowledge rather than choice gold.
ul.li1: 11For wisdom is better than jewels,
ul.li2: and all desires shall not compare with her.
ul.li1: 12I, wisdom, live with prudence,
ul.li2: and I find knowledge and discretion.
ul.li1: 13The fear of Yahweh is hatred of evil,
ul.li2: pride, and arrogance and an evil way.
And I hate a mouth of perversity.
ul.li1: 14Advice and sound judgmentLiterally “To/for me are advice and sound judgment” are mine;
ul.li2: I am understanding, strength is mine.Literally “to/for me is strength”
ul.li1: 15By me kings reign,
ul.li2: and rulers decree righteousness.
ul.li1: 16By me rulers rule,
ul.li2: and nobles—all judges of righteousness.
ul.li1: 17I love those who love me,Literally “her lovers”
ul.li2: and those who seek me diligently shall find me.
ul.li1: 18Fortune and glory are with me,
ul.li2: enduring wealth and righteousness.
ul.li1: 19My fruit is better than gold,Literally “fine gold” even refined gold,
ul.li2: and my yield than choice silver.
ul.li1: 20In the way of righteousness I walk,
ul.li2: in the midst of paths of justice,
ul.li1: 21in order to endow those who love me with wealth,
ul.li2: and I will fill their treasuries.

ul.li1: 22“Yahweh possessedOr “gained,” or “acquired” me, the first of his ways,
ul.li2: before his acts of old.Literally “from before” or “from then”
ul.li1: 23From eternity, I was set up from the first,
ul.li2: from the beginningHebrew “beginnings” of the earth.
ul.li1: 24When there were no depths, I was brought forth,
ul.li2: when there were no springs of aboundingLiterally “made heavy” water.
ul.li1: 25Before mountains had been shaped,
ul.li2: before hills, I was brought forth.
ul.li1: 26When he had not yet made earth and fields,
ul.li2: or the first dust of the world,
ul.li1: 27when he establishedLiterally “in his establishing” the heavens, there I was,
ul.li2: when he drewLiterally “in his drawing” a circle upon the face of the deep,
ul.li1: 28when he madeLiterally “in his making” skies from above,
ul.li2: when he founded fountains of the deep,
ul.li1: 29when he assignedLiterally “in his assigning” his limits to the sea,
ul.li2: that waters shall not transgress his command,Literally “mouth”
when he markedLiterally “in his marking” the foundations of the earth,
ul.li1: 30I was besideLiterally “at the place of” him, a master workman,
ul.li2: and I was delighting day by day,
rejoicing before him always,Literally “in all of time”
ul.li1: 31rejoicing in the world of his earth,
ul.li2: and my delight was with the children of humankind.

ul.li1: 32“And now, children, listen to me;
ul.li2: happy are those who will keep my ways.
ul.li1: 33Hear teaching and be wise;
ul.li2: do not neglect it.
ul.li1: 34Happy is the person who listens to me,
ul.li2: in order to keep watch at my doors day by day,
in order to guard the frames of my entrances.
ul.li1: 35For he who finds me is he who findsHebrew “those who find” life,
ul.li2: and he obtains favor from Yahweh.
ul.li1: 36But he who misses me injures himself.Or “soul,” or “inner self”
ul.li2: All those who hate me love death.”
